Legal_Issue: Whether the visa officer erred in refusing the applicants' work permit applications based on insufficient evidence and lack of procedural fairness
Outcome: Decision set aside, matter remitted for redetermination
Credibility_Assessment: Officer raised concerns about veracity of experience letters but did not disclose them to applicants
Evidence_Type: Experience letters submitted as proof of work history
Basis_of_Claim: Perceived inconsistencies and insufficient religious knowledge
Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness for factual findings, correctness for procedural fairness
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to consider key evidence and provide procedural fairness
Application_Error: Failure to acknowledge material evidence and failure to notify applicants of document authenticity concerns
Review_Outcome: Decision found unreasonable and procedurally unfair
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness and reasonableness of administrative decisions
Application_Factor: Sufficiency of evidence and applicant credibility
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable decision and breach of duty of fairness
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for factual determinations; correctness for procedural fairness
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA subsection 72(1); duty to consider all material evidence and ensure procedural fairness
Outcome_of_Review: Application allowed, decision set aside, remitted to a different officer
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived inconsistencies and insufficient religious knowledge
Procedural_Fairness: Officer failed to inform applicants of concerns regarding document authenticity
Credibility_Issues: Questions raised about authenticity of experience letters
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on unreasonableness and procedural unfairness
Procedural_Issue: Lack of notice regarding concerns about document veracity
Omission_Type: Failure to disclose concerns and consider submitted evidence
